title: Am i crazy or is there this bug where in post game chat name are showing ally's name in red?
body:
Literally spend 2 minutes thinking i was talking to the enemy team, but when i realize that the enemy all show blank (like when they leave the lobby and their names fade out), and i'm all "who the shitbags am i talking to?!?" and turns out I was talking to the ally all along...

Damn bugs, you scary!

Although I'm curious to ask, is anybody experiencing this bug too? Or is this just EUNE stuff?

replies.body: Ye it started this last patch , man it's so annoying I swear
i have experienced this as well

> [{quoted}](name=DartExplosion10,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=BJcRKfx0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-10-05T00:22:23.141+0000)
>
> i have experienced this as well

Hmm so not just EUNE
This is pretty much  a world wide bug then.
Everyone that writes in post game chat is a enemy they finally did it right! {{sticker:sg-lulu}}

I experience this too, but I'm quite sure its not a bug.

The colors of names depends on who is the true blue team and true red team. So if yous nexus is the one at the top of the map you are the red team, and names will be red despite us associating blue with an ally.

> [{quoted}](name=sssaucyboi,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=BJcRKfx0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-10-05T00:44:31.027+0000)

> The colors of names depends on who is the true blue team and true red team. So if yous nexus is the one at the top of the map you are the red team, and names will be red despite us associating blue with an ally.

I always see the ally chat in white and enemy in red in the post game chat. Regardless of which Nexus base I'm at.

The red font is used to indicate you were talking to the opponent so you won't have to search up their names in the team list and see if they're with you or not.

Been like this since 9.19 update.

But then again, my own teammates are bigger deadweight than the enemy team is.

Not a bug, it's a feature. : ^)
